Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: The Suspicions Of Mr. Whicher: The Murder At Road Hill House Review Date: 2018/06/23 Categories: Suspense, Drama, Emotional, Serious Product Description: ['Inspector Jack Whicher is part of the newly formed Scotland Yard detective department and travels to Rode, Wiltshire, to investigate a murder at a country house. With no material evidence and only an inept local police force to help, he faces the unenviable task of solving a case in which members of the grieving family are the main suspects.'] Average Rating: 3.9 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['James Hawes'], 'Producers': ['Nigel Marchant', 'Robert Bullock'], 'Starring': ['Paddy Considine', 'Peter Capaldi', 'Alexandra Roach']} Review Text: I really enjoy these episodes. The costumes, sets, lighting, and plot twists are all well done. Review Title: Five Stars Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2018/08/11 Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Starring': ['Frances McDormand', 'Richard Jenkins', 'Bill Murray']} Review Text: It was worth watching. I enjoyed watching the actors develop the characters, the sets, costumes, and the lovely areas where they filmed. Review Title: Worth the long haul Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Britannia Review Date: 2018/09/07 Categories: Drama, Historical, Fantasy, Action Product Description: ['The mysterious and tumultuous land of 43AD Britannia is occupied by many warring tribes, until the invasion of a foreign army sparks chaos and allegiances. Celtic rivals Kerra (Kelly Reilly) and Antedia (Zoë Wanamaker) must face the oncoming Roman invasion led by Aulus Plautius (David Morrissey) as it seeks to dismantle the Celtic Resistance.'] Average Rating: 3.5 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['CHRISTOPH SCHREWE'], 'Producers': ['VERTIGO FILMS', 'NEAL STREET PRODUCTIONS'], 'Starring': ['DAVID MORRISSEY', 'KELLY REILLY', 'NIKOLAJ LIE KAAS']} Review Text: I kept getting recommendations to watch this, and I honestly thought it was going to low budget and semi comedic spoof based on the production still. I never read video reviews, before watching because I don't want spoilers, and they are always so distorted in a way that is inaccurate, unfair, misleading, or simply not helpful to me. I very much enjoyed this story-line, and once again I was glad I hadn’t read negative reviews before watching. I only started reading after watching the season to determine if there will be more to come. As for history, I wouldn't ever get my facts from a show to write a research paper. Productions like this are driven by people who want it to do well and hook viewers. These types of shows are loosely based on history, and I appreciate the effort to add a bit of historical precision to adaptations. I'm not looking for a history lesson, I want entertainment. History buffs should go make their own movie --then complain about another’s. I love how critics claim ownership of historical “facts” like they have a Tardis and were actually there at the time. I dream of an internet where people would FIRST make their own movie or whatever product they go online to malign. Then I might respect their opinion when comparing products. I'd enjoy seeing how people type about their work compared with another work. Perhaps they would not be so quick to judge, because they would better appreciate and fully understand why decisions are made. Alas, all the expertise they deem worthy is having a keyboard, an internet connection, and a presumption. If you look, you'll find MOST critics haven't actually written historical works of their own, nor have they ever made their own product, movie, or show about anything they claim to be such experts on. If they were truly erudite and passionate, you would have made their own adaptations by now. Review Title: So glad I finally watched this and did not read the negative reviews! Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2018/11/21 Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Starring': ['Kristen Bell', 'Ted Danson', 'William Jackson Harper'], 'Studio': ['NBC']} Review Text: I like the writing in the show, but I sure wish each episode was double the runtime. 20 minutes goes by too fast! I'm sure it makes it easier on the cast and production to do these type of short episodes though, so as long as they keep making the show I'll be happy. Review Title: Enjoyable to follow Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2019/07/19 Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Starring': ['Kenny Florian', 'Chris Rose']} Review Text: This seasons episodes are great and I love the extras! Review Title: Worth the long haul Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Britannia Review Date: 2018/09/07 Categories: Drama, Historical, Fantasy, Action Product Description: ['The mysterious and tumultuous land of 43AD Britannia is occupied by many warring tribes, until the invasion of a foreign army sparks chaos and allegiances. Celtic rivals Kerra (Kelly Reilly) and Antedia (Zoë Wanamaker) must face the oncoming Roman invasion led by Aulus Plautius (David Morrissey) as it seeks to dismantle the Celtic Resistance.'] Average Rating: 3.5 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['CHRISTOPH SCHREWE'], 'Producers': ['VERTIGO FILMS', 'NEAL STREET PRODUCTIONS'], 'Starring': ['DAVID MORRISSEY', 'KELLY REILLY', 'NIKOLAJ LIE KAAS']} Review Text: I kept getting recommendations to watch this, and I honestly thought it was going to low budget and semi comedic spoof based on the production still. I never read video reviews, before watching because I don't want spoilers, and they are always so distorted in a way that is inaccurate, unfair, misleading, or simply not helpful to me. I very much enjoyed this story-line, and once again I was glad I hadn’t read negative reviews before watching. I only started reading after watching the season to determine if there will be more to come. As for history, I wouldn't ever get my facts from a show to write a research paper. Productions like this are driven by people who want it to do well and hook viewers. These types of shows are loosely based on history, and I appreciate the effort to add a bit of historical precision to adaptations. I'm not looking for a history lesson, I want entertainment. History buffs should go make their own movie --then complain about another’s. I love how critics claim ownership of historical “facts” like they have a Tardis and were actually there at the time. I dream of an internet where people would FIRST make their own movie or whatever product they go online to malign. Then I might respect their opinion when comparing products. I'd enjoy seeing how people type about their work compared with another work. Perhaps they would not be so quick to judge, because they would better appreciate and fully understand why decisions are made. Alas, all the expertise they deem worthy is having a keyboard, an internet connection, and a presumption. If you look, you'll find MOST critics haven't actually written historical works of their own, nor have they ever made their own product, movie, or show about anything they claim to be such experts on. If they were truly erudite and passionate, you would have made their own adaptations by now. Review Title: So glad I finally watched this and did not read the negative reviews! Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2018/11/21 Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Starring': ['Kristen Bell', 'Ted Danson', 'William Jackson Harper'], 'Studio': ['NBC']} Review Text: I like the writing in the show, but I sure wish each episode was double the runtime. 20 minutes goes by too fast! I'm sure it makes it easier on the cast and production to do these type of short episodes though, so as long as they keep making the show I'll be happy. raw_response:
**Key Preferences and Trends:**

1. **Genres**: Strong preference for **murder mysteries**, **suspense**, and **historical dramas**. Enjoyment of **comedies** and **educational content** is notable.

2. **Quality**: Consistently high ratings show a focus on well-produced content with strong **writing**, **characters**, and **production quality** (sets, costumes, lighting).

3. **Character Engagement**: Frequent mention of beloved characters indicates a strong attachment to character development in series and films, particularly in **mystery** genres.

4. **Educational Value**: Interest in media that offers a blend of entertainment and education, especially in programs aimed at younger audiences or aspiring professionals.

5. **Humor and Fun**: Enjoyment of light-hearted and silly content, as seen in preferences for humorous movies and productions that provide escapism.

6. **Critical Engagement**: Shows a tendency to disregard negative reviews and an appreciation for original storytelling, often valuing personal enjoyment over critical consensus.

7. **Longevity of Interest**: Multiple purchases of similar genres and repeated viewings suggest a desire for binge-able content that maintains engagement over time. 

8. **Ratings**: High average ratings across purchases signal satisfaction and a discerning taste for quality media. 

This individual enjoys diverse content, highlighting an affinity for engaging stories and quality production, particularly in the mystery and comedy genres.

target_interaction.title: A much needed and lovely escape from reality.
target_interaction.text: They needn't have bothered using Agatha Christie's name. It's a gripping story and Rufus Sewell did an amazing job captivating us. The clothes sets and props were gorgeous. We have watched it twice this year, and I imagine we will watch it again. So many scrumptious details to take in. A much needed and lovely escape from reality.
